ex_fuzzy.evolutionary_fit_regression.FitRuleBaseRegression#

class ex_fuzzy.evolutionary_fit_regression.FitRuleBaseRegression(X, y, nRules, nAnts, y_range=None, thread_runner=None, linguistic_variables=None, n_linguistic_variables=3, fuzzy_type=FUZZY_SETS.t1, domain=None, categorical_mask=None, tolerance=0.01, alpha=0.0, beta=0.0, rule_mode='additive', backend_name='pymoo', consequent_type='crisp', output_fuzzy_sets=None, n_output_linguistic_variables=3, universe_points=100)[source]#

Bases: FitRuleBase

Class to model regression problems for fuzzy rule bases using evolutionary strategies. Rules have numeric consequents instead of class labels.

Extends FitRuleBase but overrides evaluation functions to use regression metrics (MSE/RMSE) instead of classification metrics (MCC).

__init__(X, y, nRules, nAnts, y_range=None, thread_runner=None, linguistic_variables=None, n_linguistic_variables=3, fuzzy_type=FUZZY_SETS.t1, domain=None, categorical_mask=None, tolerance=0.01, alpha=0.0, beta=0.0, rule_mode='additive', backend_name='pymoo', consequent_type='crisp', output_fuzzy_sets=None, n_output_linguistic_variables=3, universe_points=100)[source]#

Constructor method for regression problem.

Parameters:

  • X (array) – np array or pandas dataframe samples x features.

  • y (array) – np vector containing the target values (continuous). vector sample

  • nRules (int) – number of rules to optimize.

  • nAnts (int) – max number of antecedents to use.

  • y_range (tuple) – tuple (min, max) for the output range. If None, computed from data.

  • linguistic_variables (list[fuzzyVariable]) – list of linguistic variables precomputed. If given, the rest of conflicting arguments are ignored.

  • n_linguistic_variables (int) – number of linguistic variables per antecedent.

  • fuzzy_type – Define the fuzzy set or fuzzy set extension used as linguistic variable.

  • domain (list) – list with the upper and lower domains of each input variable. If None (as default) it will establish the empirical min/max as the limits.

  • tolerance (float) – float. Tolerance for rule firing (used only in ‘sufficient’ mode).

  • alpha (float) – float. Weight for the rulebase size term in the fitness function. (Penalizes number of rules)

  • beta (float) – float. Weight for the average rule size term in the fitness function.

  • rule_mode (str) – str. ‘additive’ (all rules contribute) or ‘sufficient’ (only rules above tolerance).

  • backend_name (str) – str. Backend to use for evolutionary optimization (‘pymoo’ or ‘evox’)

  • consequent_type (str) – str. ‘crisp’ (numeric outputs) or ‘fuzzy’ (fuzzy set outputs with defuzzification).

  • output_fuzzy_sets (list[FS]) – list of fuzzy sets for output (Mamdani). If None, will be evolved.

  • n_output_linguistic_variables (int) – int. Number of output linguistic variables if not precomputed.

  • universe_points (int) – int. Number of discretization points for fuzzy inference.

Methods

__init__(X, y, nRules, nAnts[, y_range, ...])

Constructor method for regression problem.

bounds()

do(X, return_values_of, *args, **kwargs)

Constructor method for regression problem.

Parameters:

  • X (array) – np array or pandas dataframe samples x features.

  • y (array) – np vector containing the target values (continuous). vector sample

  • nRules (int) – number of rules to optimize.

  • nAnts (int) – max number of antecedents to use.

  • y_range (tuple) – tuple (min, max) for the output range. If None, computed from data.

  • linguistic_variables (list[fuzzyVariable]) – list of linguistic variables precomputed. If given, the rest of conflicting arguments are ignored.

  • n_linguistic_variables (int) – number of linguistic variables per antecedent.

  • fuzzy_type – Define the fuzzy set or fuzzy set extension used as linguistic variable.

  • domain (list) – list with the upper and lower domains of each input variable. If None (as default) it will establish the empirical min/max as the limits.

  • tolerance (float) – float. Tolerance for rule firing (used only in ‘sufficient’ mode).

  • alpha (float) – float. Weight for the rulebase size term in the fitness function. (Penalizes number of rules)

  • beta (float) – float. Weight for the average rule size term in the fitness function.

  • rule_mode (str) – str. ‘additive’ (all rules contribute) or ‘sufficient’ (only rules above tolerance).

  • backend_name (str) – str. Backend to use for evolutionary optimization (‘pymoo’ or ‘evox’)

  • consequent_type (str) – str. ‘crisp’ (numeric outputs) or ‘fuzzy’ (fuzzy set outputs with defuzzification).

  • output_fuzzy_sets (list[FS]) – list of fuzzy sets for output (Mamdani). If None, will be evolved.

  • n_output_linguistic_variables (int) – int. Number of output linguistic variables if not precomputed.

  • universe_points (int) – int. Number of discretization points for fuzzy inference.

has_torch_eval()[source]#

Check if PyTorch evaluation is available.

Returns:

True if torch is available, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

fitness_func(ruleBase, X, y, tolerance, alpha=0.0, beta=0.0, precomputed_truth=None)[source]#

Fitness function for regression using RMSE.

Parameters:

  • ruleBase (RuleBase) – RuleBase object

  • X (array) – input samples

  • y (array) – target values

  • tolerance (float) – tolerance for rule evaluation

  • alpha (float) – weight for rule size penalty

  • beta (float) – weight for average antecedents penalty

  • precomputed_truth (array) – precomputed membership values

Returns:

fitness value (higher is better)

Return type:

float
